definition: temporary housing built with wooden planks or other makeshift materials
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Parkview room decorated around the island model drawings.
sentences.chinese: 環島麗園樣板房裝飾施工圖。

sentences.english: The players lived in plank houses.
sentences.chinese: 而運動員們住的是板房。

sentences.english: The damaged shack was taken away by a chengguan truck, Zhang said.
sentences.chinese: 被破壞的板房當時由城管的卡車運走。

sentences.english: The place looked like a miniature version of something you'd see in a decorating magazine.
sentences.chinese: 這個地方看起來像是裝修雜誌上看到的迷你樣板房。

sentences.english: Prefabricated house is a kind of light steel structure modular house with the color steel sandwich panel.
sentences.chinese: 活動板房是一種採用彩鋼夾芯板的輕鋼結構移動房屋。

sentences.english: We designed for the project two sets of sample housings with different styles.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲該樓盤設計了兩套不同風格的樣板房。

sentences.english: Show Flats, Marketing Office and Club-house Interior design for Empire Plaza, Beijing, PRC. 4000sqm.
sentences.chinese: 北京京皇廣場，會所和樣板房室內設計。

sentences.english: Show flats with a four season theme in different styles.
sentences.chinese: 以四季爲主題的樣板房，各具高雅品味。

sentences.english: The compound also has a demonstration house powered by solar panels.
sentences.chinese: 院子裏還有一間使用太陽能的樣板房。

sentences.english: Greenland Office model flat, Shanghai, 2006 Interior.
sentences.chinese: 綠地樣板房辦公室，上海，2006年室內。

definition: Pingfang district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1] in Heilongjiang
a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
to build (esp. with simple materials)/to knock together (a temporary shed)/to rig up
a building used as a factory/factory (building)/CL:座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
